snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry and Russia’s foreign minister, Sergey V. Lavrov, have found a common purpose in trying to negotiate a Syria settlement, even though positions have not changed.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry and Russian Foreign Min Sergey V Lavrov have found common purpose in trying to negotiate Syria settlement, even though positions have not changed.

byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers reported from Washington, and David M. Herszenhorn from Moscow. Thom Shanker contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry and Russia’s foreign minister, Sergey V. Lavrov, have found a common purpose in trying to negotiate a Syria settlement, even though positions have not changed.

headline.main: U.S.-Russian Diplomacy, With a Personal Touch
headline.print_headline: U.S.-Russian Diplomacy, With a Personal Touch
